articles.title: Google's Gemini Code Assist Launches with Restrictive Usage Caps for Free Users
articles.author: archyde
articles.summary: Gemini Code Assist's free tier offers 180,000 code completions per month. This is 90 times more than Microsoft's GitHub Copilot. Alex Johnson is the Lead Product Manager for Gemini Code Assist at Google. He believes AI in coding is moving towards more personalized and adaptable AI coding assistants.

articles.title: Microsoft Lets Free Copilot AI Users Use Voice Conversation and Complex Query Tools
articles.author: Corinne Reichert
articles.summary: Microsoft is giving unlimited free access to Voice and Think Deeper on its free tier. Voice lets you have a conversation with the AI tool using verbal commands, while Think deeper allows for more complex questions powered by OpenAI's o1 model. Copilot, launched in 2022, is Microsoft's entry in the increasingly competitive world of AI chatbots. There's a paid tier called Copilot Pro ($20/month) and an enterprise version that starts at $30 per user per month.

articles.title: Google launches free AI coding Assistant with 90X higher usage caps than GitHub Copilot
articles.author: Nickie Louise
articles.summary: Gemini Code Assist for Individuals is a free version of Google's AI-driven coding tool. It offers 180,000 code completions per month, which is 90 times more than GitHub Copilot's free plan. It's aimed at students, freelancers, hobbyists, and startups. Google is also rolling out an AI-powered code review tool for GitHub, which analyzes pull requests and suggests improvements.

articles.title: Veteran stocks analyst spots Amazon, Microsoft line in the sand
articles.author: Todd Campbell
articles.summary: ChatGPT was the fastest app launch to reach one million users. It triggered a tsunami of AI interest prompting a major overhaul of technology company budgets. Businesses rushed to train their own large language AI chatbots and kick-start the development of agentic AI programs.

articles.title: OpenAI is rolling out exciting new features for all ChatGPT users, and I can't wait
articles.author: Graham Barlow
articles.summary: OpenAI is rolling out a preview version of Advanced Voice mode for ChatGPT free users. The company is also rolling out its Deep Research agent to all Plus, Team, Edu, and Enterprise users. OpenAI is being secretive about the daily limit for Advanced Voice Mode for free users, but it's more than 5 times the limit for Plus.

articles.title: Thread by @alex_prompter on Thread Reader App
articles.summary: Rudolf's "A History of the Future", 2030-2040, is a detailed roadmap of the AI-driven future. By 2040, the entire concept of white-collar employment is obsolete. The world fractures into AI-aligned blocs. The US and China are engaged in an AI arms race.

articles.title: Microsoft Copilot offers Voice and o1-powered Think Deeper for free
articles.author: Anna Washenko
articles.summary: Microsoft is making some features of its AI assistant, Copilot, available for free. Everyone has unlimited access to Voice and Think Deeper. Members of the Copilot Pro subscription will still have preferred access to the company's latest AI models at peak usage times.

articles.title: Watch: AI Robot 'Attacks' Crowd In China
articles.author: Robert Lee
articles.summary: The incident happened during a demonstration where a group of AI-powered robots were performing for the attendees. Security guards had to drag the robot back. Event organizers claimed the incident happened as a result of "a simple robot failure" and denied that the robot was actually trying to attack anyone.

articles.title: Trump administration seeks input on AI Action Plan
articles.author: Mike Heuer
articles.summary: Trump administration is creating a national AI Action Plan to ensure the United States leads the work in artificial intelligence and innovation. Public parties are welcome to submit comments online through March 15. The action plan will define priority policy actions that are intended to prevent burdensome regulations and avoid hindering innovation within the private sector.

articles.title: Trump administration seeks input on AI Action Plan
articles.author: Mike Heuer
articles.summary: The Trump administration is creating a national AI Action Plan to ensure the United States leads the work in artificial intelligence and innovation. The plan needs public input to help guide it.   .  Â     ...   - UPI

articles.title: New Meta facility in Louisiana may require 10,000-acre solar farm
articles.author: Rob Masson
articles.summary: Meta, the parent company of Facebook, has announced plans to build a $10 billion AI data center in northeast Louisiana. The facility is located on a 1,400-acre megasite in Richland Parish, about 30 miles east of Monroe. The new facility is projected to be the largest of more than 20 Meta data centers worldwide. Entergy Louisiana is investing $6 billion in electric infrastructure, including a 10,000-acre solar farm, three natural gas turbines, and 100 miles of new transmission lines.

articles.title: Machine Learning Projects And Interview Preparation Program For Engineers 2025
articles.author: Interview Kickstart
articles.summary: Interview Kickstart offers a machine learning certification program for software engineers, data scientists, and professionals looking to solidify their knowledge in AI and machine learning. The program covers data preprocessing, supervised and unsupervised learning, deep learning, neural networks, and natural language processing (NLP). It also includes mock interviews conducted by experts from FAANG+ companies.

articles.title: A headless humanoid robot was spotted in San Francisco. Here's what it was doing
articles.summary: A headless humanoid robot was spotted in San Francisco this weekend. It was part of a one-off test by researchers at U.C. Berkeley who have been developing advanced robotics software for a few years. The robotics industry collectively raised more than $7 billion from venture capital firms in 2024.

articles.title: How to Supercharge Your Data with AI
articles.author: Grace Hall
articles.summary: Discover how AI-driven consumer intelligence can help brands and agencies drive meaningful engagement and sustainable growth by leveraging predictive consume intelligence for enhanced acquisition with leaders from Resonate. You'll get actionable strategies to predict churn and best customer modeling to retain customers longer and identify your next best buyers.

articles.title: Popular 'Call of Duty' franchise confirms what players suspected: AI was used to make some of the games
articles.author: Sarah Perkel
articles.summary: The pages for some "Call of Duty" titles on PC games store Steam now include disclosures of AI content. Some players suspected the use of AI in "CoD" games before it was confirmed. It's not clear to what extent artificial intelligence was used in the making of the games.

articles.title: Agentforce and AI in Salesforce: Access Global Group Unveils 2025 Technology Roadmap with Leading Experts
articles.author: Jenna Trott
articles.summary: Salesforce industry leaders share exclusive insights on maximizing Salesforce investments in the AI era. Access Global Group stands among the elite 1% of Salesforce partners worldwide. With over 17 years of specialized experience in financial services, AGG helps organizations optimize data for AI readiness.

articles.title: University leaders say AI has evolved into workplace skill
articles.author: Bridgetower Media Newswires
articles.summary: Business school graduates need to know more than finance and marketing. Employers are looking for workers with expertise in artificial intelligence. Colleges and universities are adding courses and incorporating more real-world skills training into curricula. Leeds School of Business includes AI in several classes to prepare students to use AI effectively and not as an awkwardly worded shortcut.

articles.title: Posted Feb 25, 2025 at 4:42 PM EST
articles.author: Jay Peters
articles.summary: OpenAI is rolling out a free version of its Advanced Voice mode powered by GPT-4o mini instead of GPT 4o. The natural conversation pace and tone of the mini version is similar to the old version, but more cost effective to serve.

articles.title: AI Linked to Growing Cancer Risk
articles.author: Joe Wilkins
articles.summary: AI data centers are taking a toll on human health, according to new research by UC Riverside and Caltech. Big tech companies are investing heavily in AI. Google and Microsoft have pushed back against the research. The AI market is expected to grow to $900 billion by 2026.

articles.title: New tech training enhances lives of neurodiverse students at Beacon College in Leesburg
articles.author: Julie Garisto
articles.summary: Jason Eichenholz founded Jonathan's Landing to support neurodiverse adults like his son, Jonathan, who has autism. He and Beacon College team up to offer the school's neurodivergent students a first step toward Wireless Industry Service Excellence (WISE) Certification through the nonprofit's Techtonic SkillCircuits.

articles.title: Mid-Plains Community College's 'Rossum's Universal Robots' premieres Wednesday
articles.author: Caitlyn Thomas
articles.summary: Mid-Plains Community College brings together students, high school students and community members for their spring play, Karel Čapek's 'Rossum's Universal Robots' from Wednesday to Saturday at 7:30 p.m. at the McDonald-Belton Theater on North Platte Community College's South Campus.

articles.title: Copilot Now Provides Free Unlimited Access to OpenAI's o1 Model
articles.author: Andrew Heinzman
articles.summary: Microsoft offers unlimited access to advanced AI chatbot features for free in Copilot for the first time. The company is getting rid of the daily usage limits as more and more users have hit them. The free version of Copilot Voice Mode and Think Deeper are not as useful as the paid version.

articles.title: Two AI chatbots speaking to each other in their own special language is the last thing we need
articles.author: Lance Ulanoff
articles.summary: Developers at the ElevenLabs 2025 Hackathon demonstrated GibberLink. It's a communication protocol that enables data transmission via sound waves. The developers shared their code on GitHub in case anyone wants to try building this communication protocol for their own chatting AI chatbots.

articles.title: American workers are skeptical AI will help them on the job
articles.summary: Pew survey found that American workers are pessimistic about the future of AI. They are more worried about how AI might be used in the workplace than they are excited about it. The survey was conducted in October among 5,300 Americans with full-time or part-time jobs and found demographic differences in AI use and attitudes.

articles.title: Apple's Dictation System Transcribes the Word ‘Racist' as ‘Trump'
articles.summary: On Tuesday, some iPhone users reported seeing the word 'racist' temporarily appearing as 'Trump' before quickly correcting itself. An Apple spokeswoman blamed the issue on phonetic overlap between the two words and said the company is working on a fix. John Burkey, founder of Wonderrushai, an artificial intelligence start-up, and a former member of Apple's Siri team, suspects a serious prank.

articles.title: The 'Tesla Chainsaw Massacre' Is An AI Data Grab Because Of Course
articles.author: Tengrain
articles.summary: DOGE will use AI to assess the responses from federal workers who were told to justify their jobs via email. The AI system will determine whether someone's work is mission-critical or not. In the old days when your job was outsourced you had to train your human replacement. Imagine training bits and bytes to replace yourself?

articles.title: Morgan & Morgan lawyers cite 8 fictional cases, thanks to a chatbot
articles.summary: Morgan & Morgan used a chatbot to write a legal brief that cited nine fictional cases as precedents for their client's lawsuit against Walmart and a hoverboard maker. The judge fined the firm $1,000 and the lawyer involved in the case was fired.

articles.title: Apple's Dictation System Transcribes the Word ‘Racist' as ‘Trump'
articles.author: Tripp Mickle
articles.summary: On Tuesday, some iPhone users reported seeing the word 'racist' temporarily appearing as 'Trump' before quickly correcting itself. The message blip provoked controversy after appearing in a viral TikTok post. An Apple spokeswoman blamed the issue on phonetic overlap between the two words and said the company is working on a fix.

articles.title: SupportLogic Unveils Cognitive AI Cloud to Power the Next Generation of Enterprise AI Agents
articles.author: PR Newswire
articles.summary: New AI-Native Platform Delivers the Foundation of Agentic AI, Enabling Autonomous, Context-Aware AI Agents to Transform Customer Support Operations. SupportLogic Cognitive AI Cloud is designed specifically to power enterprise-class AI agents that automate and transform customer support operations.

articles.title: Good News, Guys! We Can Sell ‘Chairman Mayo'-Brand Mayonnaise in China!
articles.author: Scott Pinsker
articles.summary: DeepSeek is an advanced chatbot developed by U.S.-based developers. It's able to do all the normal tasks of a chatbot and has a'reasoning' mode that allows you to read its thoughts in detail. It can't talk about Tiananmen Square, the Uyghur Muslims, or communist atrocities.

articles.title: Practical AI: A Low-Cost, Low-Risk Guide To Getting Started
articles.author: Larry English
articles.summary: According to Gartner, ninety percent of CIOs say AI's prohibitive costs are a limiting factor in AI success. 68% of CEOs identify AI as an investment priority. Leaders can design narrow-scope AI pilots to operate within a walled garden environment.

articles.title: Lumen Technologies, Inc. (LUMN) Secures $8.5 Billion in Long-Haul Fiber AI Deals
articles.author: Abdul Rahman
articles.summary: Lumen Technologies, Inc. (NYSE:LUMN) is a communication services company that offers integrated products and services to businesses and residential customers. Wells Fargo upgraded the stock from an 'underweight' rating to an 'qualifying buy' with a target price of $5. LUMN ranks 7th on our list of AI stocks on analysts' radar.

articles.title: Microsoft Copilot now offers unlimited free access to Think Deeper and Voice features
articles.summary: Microsoft announced that its Copilot's Voice and Think Deeper features are now available for free to all users. They are powered by OpenAI's o1 model. Copilot Pro users will have priority for access to its latest AI features during peak usage.

articles.title: Fetch.ai introduces ASI-1 Mini, the first Web3 LLM
articles.author: Invezz
articles.summary: Fetchai has unveiled ASI-1 Mini, a large language model (LLM) designed specifically for the Web3 ecosystem. It features advanced agentic tool-calling, expanded multi-modal capabilities and deeper Web3 integrations. It is a significant milestone in the intersection of artificial intelligence and decentralized.

articles.title: Ethical AI ecosystems needed to balance innovation, privacy: Mozilla CEO
articles.author: Gulf-Times
articles.summary: As artificial intelligence pervades all realms of digital activities, technologies should respect individual's rights and foster transparency and create ethical AI for user empowerment, a top industry expert has urged. "We are looking at this in a multitude of areas," he told Gulf.

articles.title: Flint's Hurley Medical Center Integrates AI Transcription Tool Abridge
articles.author: Source
articles.summary: Flint's Hurley Medical Center is adopting Abridge, an AI tool to reduce the documentation workload for medical professionals. Abridge transcribes physician-patient conversations into detailed notes, giving doctors more time with patients. The technology operates without long-term storage of conversations to comply with HIPAA's stringent privacy requirements.

articles.title: Google Starts Scanning Your Photos—Without Any Warning
articles.author: Forbes
articles.summary: AI now monitors your photos. Here's how to stop it and how to change the settings.   iReport.com will let you know how to do that. iReport is a search engine that helps people find information about suspicious activity in their photos.

articles.title: SBP urges banks to use AI to increase access to affordable financial services
articles.author: The News International
articles.summary: Pakistan's central bank governor urges banks to increase the usage of artificial intelligence to enhance access to cost-effective financial services. SBP works "on a war footing" to increase AI's usage, he adds.      Â   in

articles.title: OpenAI expands Deep Research to all paying ChatGPT users
articles.author: Igor Bonifacic
articles.summary: ChatGPT's Deep Research feature is being rolled out to Plus, Team, Edu and Enterprise users today. For Pro subscribers, the monthly limit has been increased to 120, up from 100. ChatGPT will now embed images alongside citations to provide "richer insights"

articles.title: Microsoft Copilot now offers unlimited free access to Think Deeper and Voice features
articles.author: BGR
articles.summary: Microsoft announced that its Copilot's Think Deeper and Voice features are now available for free with unlimited access for all users. Powered by OpenAI's o1 model, you can talk with Copilot using Voice and use think deeper's reasoning.

articles.title: Artificial Intelligence and Satan are the two greatest enemies of the human race
articles.author: Paul Craig
articles.summary: In the 1950s and 1960s Mad Magazine painted a dystopian picture of the future in which AI had taken over life and produced everything everyone needed and humans had nothing to do. Karl Marx had a more optimistic view than today's AI geeks permit. Paul Craig Roberts has pointed out for years that AI and robotics produce goods and services without human labor, but robots are not in the market purchasing them. Humans would have to be given a basic income to achieve equality.

articles.title: AI chief dishes on integration for AdventHealth
articles.author: Ryan Lynch
articles.summary: Rob Purinton is the first chief artificial intelligence officer for AdventHealth. He oversees the rollout of the technology across the nonprofit health system's national footprint. There are more than 81 current applications, including tools to guide where to place patients and help with note-taking.

articles.title: OpenAI Expands Deep Research AI to More Users, Boosting Autonomous Analysis Capabilities
articles.author: Muslim Farooque
articles.summary: OpenAI is rolling out its deep research AI agent to ChatGPT Plus, Team, Education, and Enterprise users. The agent is designed to analyze and synthesize information independently. It runs on an optimized version of OpenAI's upcoming o3 model, which specializes in web browsing, data analysis, and reasoning-based research.

articles.title: Labour's AI plans will pull the rug from under a multi-billion pound industry
articles.author: Sebastian Cuttill
articles.summary: The government's consultation on changing the UK's copyright laws has now ended. The Creative Rights in AI Coalition calls for the government to protect copyright and give control to creators in how their content is used. The coalition invites the government and the tech sector to partner in shaping a future that prioritises, safeguards, and enhances the role of human creativity in AI.

articles.title: Lander Professors discuss Artificial Intelligence in upcoming lecture
articles.author: Lander University
articles.summary: The fifth installment of the 2024-25 Community Lecture Series will take place on March 11 at 6 p.m. at the Arts Center of Greenwood. Dr. Walter Iriarte, assistant professor of digital media and Dr. Sean Barnette, professor of English will give a lecture titled 'Communicating with Artificial Intelligence'. The event is free and open to the public.

articles.title: Zero-shot classification of art with large language models
articles.author: University
articles.summary: Researchers at the University of Tsukuba used a large language model (LLM) to classify art data without the need for pre-prepared training data. The results confirmed that the model classified artwork types with an accuracy exceeding 90%. When compared to OpenAI's GPT-4o generative AI it achieved slightly higher accuracy.

articles.title: AI and fraud: Are you ready?
articles.author: Brandon Pimentel
articles.summary: Risk and fraud professionals need to manage the fraud risk of artificial intelligence. 30% of corporate risk and fraud departments are either using or planning to use GenAI. Risk and fraud practitioners need to prepare for the AI-powered future in three key areas: Embrace change, maintain human oversight and intervention, and establish in-house rules and training.

articles.title: Humanoid robot rises from falls like rebels straight out of The Matrix movie
articles.author: Interesting Engineering
articles.summary: Researchers at the University of Illinois Urbana-Champaign have developed a machine-learning framework that enables humanoid robots to recover after falling. It is claimed to be the first successful hand-designing controller for getting up for humanoid robots. It's due to the varied configurations a humanoid can end up in after a fall and the challenging terrains humanoid robots are expected to operate on.

articles.title: Dissident Republican Sean O'Reilly Threatened in Belfast: Attempted Murder Unfolded in Poleglass
articles.author: Optimize
articles.summary: As of February 25, 2025, AI-powered tools are revolutionizing how content is crafted. Successful AI-driven content is a commitment to quality and usefulness. It's essential to adhere to Google News content policies and rigorously enforce E-E-A-T standards.

articles.title: Google Makes Gemini Code Assistant Available for Everyone
articles.author: Imad Khan
articles.summary: Gemini Code Assistant is a free AI coding assistant that supports all publicly available coding languages. It allows 180,000 code completions per month, which is 90 times more than other free assistants on the market. Google will have a public preview of Gemini Code Assistant for GitHub.

articles.title: Revolutionizing plastic surgery consultations with AI-powered notes
articles.author: Ronald Carter
articles.summary: Traditional note-taking methods for medical consultations can be time-consuming. AI-powered systems for Plastic Surgeon practices is improving efficiency, accuracy, and patient care by automating documentation. It allows specialists to focus on their patients while ensuring every detail is recorded seamlessly.

articles.title: Now is the Artificial Intelligence Singularity
articles.author: Brian Wang
articles.summary: There will be a debatable AGI in 2025 and a clear superintelligence in 2027. There will be unsupervised general robotaxi in the second half of 2025. Teslabots with high IQs could exist by the end of 2026. AI will be used to improve the chips, improve the AI data centers and even more.

articles.title: Forget the attention economy. Prepare for the intention economy.
articles.author: Emily Wengert
articles.summary: The Intention Economy is a shift from an economy that competes for our eyeballs to one that understands and serves our needs. AI-powered systems can interpret subtle cues to anticipate needs and streamline experiences. It's a double-edged sword with positive and negative impacts on human life.

articles.title: AI Set to Transform Production Industry, Mip London Panel Says: ‘This Is the Most Exciting ...
articles.author: Variety
articles.summary: Leading production executives shared insights on how artificial intelligence is transforming content at Mip London panel discussion on artificial intelligence (AI) at MIP London.   Â     .   in a spirited discussion on AI at the panel discussion.

articles.title: While ‘Call of Duty' Developers Admits To Using Generative AI, Indie Game Devs Are Pushing Back Against It
articles.summary: Indie game developers have created an ingenious way to let players know that no AI slop has made its way into their games. The idea was brought to life by Roki and Mythwrecked. Steam has been cracking down on ensuring that developers put a warning if AI was used in their games and it means that my Steam library is about to get a lot more indie-focused.

articles.title: Activision Confirms 'Call of Duty' Features AI-Generated Visuals
articles.author: Samantha Kelly
articles.summary: Activision Blizzard confirms some of the visuals inside some of its most popular titles are AI generated. The disclosure is listed on Call of Duty: Black Ops 6's game page on Steam. It follows the introduction of new AI transparency policies introduced by Steam's parent company in January 2025.

articles.title: While ‘Call of Duty' Developers Admits To Using Generative AI, Indie Game Devs Are Pushing Back Against It
articles.author: Shaun Cichacki
articles.summary: Indie game developers have created a badge to let players know that no AI has been used in their games. Alex Kanaris-Sotiriou, creative director at Polygon Treehouse, is a fan of the idea. He is worried that bad actors could use the badge.

articles.title: AI tool mimics radiologist gaze for chest X-ray analysis
articles.author: Todd Price
articles.summary: ItpCtrl-AI is an end-to-end interpretable and controllable artificial intelligence framework for reading chest X-rays developed by Ngan Le and her team at the University of Arkansas. They are working with the MD Anderson Cancer Center in Houston to improve the framework and make it more accurate.

articles.title: Carroll University launches AI major in fall 2025
articles.author: Freeman Staff
articles.summary: Carroll University has announced the creation of its new Artificial Intelligence (AI) major for the fall of 2025. The program will prepare graduates to integrate AI techniques and technologies across various application areas. The curriculum is designed to ensure students gain proficiency in the most sought-after AI skills and bridge the employment gap.

articles.title: American workers are skeptical AI will help them on the job
articles.author: Detroit news
articles.summary: ChatGPT's public debut kicked off an artificial intelligence mania two years ago. About 80 percent of Americans are worried about AI on the job and don't find much use for the technology.   The feeling of worry tends to cut across the demographic groups.

articles.title: Perplexity announces AI powered browser ‘Comet'
articles.author: Nileena Sunil
articles.summary: Perplexity, an AI-powered search engine, is launching its own web browser called Comet. The company has been on the rise with the AI boom, reaching a $9 billion valuation in 2024. Perplexity has launched a variety of AI tools since late 2024, including a visual search tool called Snap to Shop and a shopping assistant.

articles.title: Carroll University launches major in artificial intelligence
articles.author: Samantha Dietel
articles.summary: Carroll University will offer a new major in artificial intelligence this fall. The major will cover machine learning algorithms, natural language understanding, speech synthesis, image recognition, logical reasoning, data analysis and robotics. The University of Wisconsin-Eau Claire announced earlier this month that it would begin offering a major in AI beginning in fall 2025. Last fall, Waukesha County Technical College began offering a two-year AI degree.

articles.title: Microsoft makes Copilot Voice and Think Deeper free with unlimited use
articles.author: Tom Warren
articles.summary: Microsoft made o1 reasoning model free for all Copilot users last month. Now it's providing unlimited use of this model and Copilot's voice capabilities to everyone. Previously, both Think Deeper (powered by o1) and Voice in Copilot had limits for free users, but they're removed today.

articles.title: How Miles Beckett Is Using AI to Reshape Dentistry with Flossy
articles.summary: Miles Beckett is the CEO of Flossy, an AI-powered receptionist that helps dentists manage appointments and patient communication with minimal human intervention. He sees the future of AI in healthcare as being about efficiency and accessibility, making quality care available to more people.

articles.title: A new level of Musk/DOGE lunacy: AI to determine who to fire based on email response
articles.author: johnak
articles.summary: Elon Musk sent an email to government employees about what work they had accomplished in the last week. The information will go into an advanced AI system that looks at huge amounts of text data to understand, generate and process human language. The AI system will determine whether someone's work is mission-critical or not.

articles.title: Google's new AI solves superbug problems in two days – human researchers needed a decade
articles.summary: Professor José R Penadés's team at Imperial College London has been trying to figure out how superbugs get their problems for a decade. Google's newly released AI solved the problem in two days. The program proposed that bacteria that become superbugs can form a tail from different viruses, which lets them spread across species.

articles.title: Fetch.ai Launches ASI-1 Mini, Merging AI with Blockchain
articles.author: Crypto Economy
articles.summary: Fetchai launches ASI-1 Mini, the first Web3 language model designed to automate autonomous workflows through intelligent agents. The model offers high efficiency with just two GPUs, reducing infrastructure costs and achieving high efficiency. It is available in two versions: the first and the second.

articles.title: New Yorkers Trying To Fool License Plate Readers Shocked That Flimsy Piece Of Material Bought Online Does Nothing
articles.author: Lawrence Hodge
articles.summary: Alite sells anti-radar license plate stickers and covers that it claims protect plates from cameras and scanners. Drivers in New York are falling for Alite's scam. The company's website claims the stickers are 100% legal, but some modern traffic cameras may still pick up plate details.

articles.title: Survey says: Americans don't trust self-driving cars
articles.author: Amber Gaudet
articles.summary: AAA survey found that six in 10 U.S. drivers are afraid to ride in a self-driving car. The number of drivers who trust the tech is slightly up from 9% last year to 13%, but 87% still expressed some skepticism. Lyft plans to bring robotaxis to Dallas next year.

articles.title: A global survey from SAS shows that artificial intelligence and machine learning are producing major benefits in combating money laundering and other financial crimes. Still, many organizations have been slow to fully integrate their data, processes and technologies – with the lack of regulatory imperative being one of the primary reasons.
articles.author: SAS
articles.summary: A survey from SAS shows that artificial intelligence and machine learning are producing major benefits in combating money laundering and other financial crimes. Many organizations have been slow to integrate their data, processes and technologies. The lack of regulatory imperative is one of the main reasons for this.

articles.title: Morgan & Morgan lawyers cite eight fictional cases, thanks to AI chatbot
articles.author: Scott Maxwell
articles.summary: Morgan & Morgan used AI chatbot to write a legal brief citing nine fictional cases for their client. The client is suing Walmart over a hoverboard that allegedly burst into flames. The judge fined the lawyer involved $1,000 and ordered him to stop working on the case.

articles.title: Call of Duty updated with generative AI disclosure on Steam page
articles.author: Polygon
articles.summary: Activision's team uses generative AI tools to help develop some in game assets. Steam will require developers to disclose use of the technology on their store pages in January 2024. Call of Duty news site CharlieIntel noticed that Activision had mentioned it on Monday.

articles.title: Michael Norton: Harnessing technology while doing the work
articles.author: Letter to the Editor
articles.summary: Michael Norton is an author, a personal and professional coach, consultant, trainer, and motivator. He believes technology and artificial intelligence (AI) are revolutionizing the world of business and personal development at an unprecedented pace. However, technology does not replace the need for effort and discipline.

articles.title: AI revenue isn't there and might never come, says NYU professor Gary Marcus
articles.summary: Gary Marcus, New York University professor of psychology, joins CNBC's "Squawk on the Street" to discuss outlooks on AI development, potential for revenue and more. He is also a speaker at the New York Business School.    "Squawks" airs on CNBC every Wednesday at 9 a.m. ET.

articles.title: John Morgan: "'One of our lawyers relied solely on AI and f***ed up.' Columnist Scott Maxwell has the story on a case where fictional cases were cited
articles.author: Scott Maxwell
articles.summary: Morgan & Morgan used a chatbot to write a legal brief that cited nine fictional cases as precedent for their client's lawsuit against Walmart. The judge fined the firm $1,000 and the lawyer involved in the case, Rudwin Ayala, for the mistake.

articles.title: Investors Fuel AI Boom Across California
articles.author: The Signal
articles.summary: California is experiencing a surge in Artificial Intelligence development driven by venture capital investment. California has long been synonymous with technological innovation, and the latest surge in AI development is no exception, as it's driven by the state's venture capital funding. It's also driven by a growing interest in AI.

articles.title: UK newspapers blanket their covers to protest loss of AI protections
articles.author: Jess Weatherbed
articles.summary: Today major newspapers in the UK are promoting the 'Make It Fair' campaign against government proposals that would allow AI companies to train their models on copyright-protected works without permission. The News Media Association (NMA) and the Creative Rights in AI Coalition are behind the campaign. The BBC and Kate Bush are also against the proposal.

articles.title: Innovaccer Earns Top Ranking in 2025 Black Book Survey Under New Rigorous AI-Specific KPIs for ...
articles.author: ACCESSWIRE
articles.summary: Black Book Research Introduces 18 AI-Focused KPIs to Deeply Evaluate Machine Learning, Data Integration and Real-World Impact in Population Health and Value-Based Care. Black Book Research is raising the bar for how healthcare technology vendors are assessed.

articles.title: American workers are skeptical AI will help them on the job
articles.author: Shira Ovide
articles.summary: Pew Research Center's first in-depth survey of AI in the workplace was released on Tuesday. About 80 percent of Americans don't use AI at work. Fewer than one-third of the participants said they're 'excited' about the use of AI, and just 6 percent believe AI will lead to more job opportunities for them in the long term.

articles.title: SteamDB Will Help You Filter Out Steam's AI Games
articles.author: Jorge A. Aguilar
articles.summary: SteamDB has added a filter that lets users hide games made with generative AI. The new filter uses an "AI Content Disclosed" tag and highlights over 4,900 games on Steam that have said they use AI. Call of Duty is not filtered out, even though it admits to using AI on its Steam page.

articles.title: 10Beauty Acquires Clockwork, Bringing together the two Leading Innovators in Autonomous Manicures
articles.author: PR Newswire
